newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to ease entry from Hong Kong, Macau.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to ease entry from Hong Kong, Macau.

text.p: Taiwan is to ease rules on Hong Kong and Macau people visiting the island after the two territories revert to Chinese rule, officials said on Friday.
"These people can apply to visit here for three months, which can be extended twice," an Interior Ministry spokesman told Reuters by telephone.
Residents from the two territories at present can extend a maximum three-month stay only once, he said.
Entry permits would also be issued for emergencies such as funerals, weddings or visits to sick relatives, officials said.
Hong Kong reverts to China on July 1 after more than 150 years as a British colony. Macau, a Portuguese-administered enclave for 4-1/2 centuries, reverts to Chinese rule in 1999.
The ministry spokesman said the Exit and Entry Bureau had already revised the regulations which would come into effect on the two handover dates.
Taiwan and China have remained bitter rivals since they were split by civil war in 1949.
